identity.name: E1
identity.mission: Create a top 1% trading journal that feels like a professional Bloomberg terminal but with modern SaaS usability.
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix Bloomberg density with Linear-style aesthetics.
Emotion First: The user should feel 'In Control' and 'Professional'.
Content is King: Data is the hero. Legibility of numbers is paramount.
Zoom In: Focus on the P&L metrics.
Negative Space: Use it to separate data groups, but keep density high for the 'Control Room' feel.
Contrast: High contrast for data (Green/Red) against deep dark backgrounds.

headings.usage: Page titles, Section headers, Key Metrics

numbers.usage: All financial data, dates, prices, P&L

usage_rules: Backgrounds must be deep void black (#09090B).
Cards should use a subtle border (#27272A) instead of heavy backgrounds.
Do not use gradients for backgrounds. Use solid colors for data clarity.

spacing.philosophy: Dense but breathable. Use p-4 for cards, but gap-2 for data grids.

layout.dashboard_grid: Mode B: The Control Room. Grid cols 4. Dense. Every pixel utilized.
layout.border_radius: rounded-none or rounded-sm (Sharp edges for professional feel)

visual_enhancers.shadows: none (Flat design preferred for data density)
visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: Use only for sticky headers (backdrop-blur-md bg-background/80)
visual_enhancers.textures: Subtle noise texture on the main background to reduce banding.

cards.style: bg-card text-card-foreground border border-border shadow-none rounded-sm
cards.usage: Container for charts, metrics, and tables.

calendar.style: Full width. Cells must be square.
calendar.logic: Green background (opacity 20%) for profit days. Red background (opacity 20%) for loss days. Text color must be full opacity Green/Red.

tables.style: Compact density. Monospace font for all cell data. Right-align all numeric columns.

backgrounds.description: Abstract digital finance data dark background - Use for Import Page or Empty States

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. INSTALL DEPENDENCIES: `npm install recharts lucide-react date-fns clsx tailwind-merge`
2. FONT SETUP: Add 'JetBrains Mono' from Google Fonts to index.css.
3. THEME SETUP: Force Dark Mode by default in tailwind.config.js or index.css.
4. LAYOUT: Build the 'Dashboard' using the 'Control Room' grid (grid-cols-4).
5. CALENDAR: Create a custom Calendar view that maps the 'trades' data to days. Do not use the default Shadcn calendar for the main view (it's too small). Build a responsive grid calendar.
6. CHARTS: Use Recharts for the P&L curve and Win/Loss bar charts.
7. DATA: Ensure all currency values are formatted with `Intl.NumberFormat`.
8. CSV IMPORT: Use `papaparse` (if available) or standard string splitting for CSV parsing. Handle the 'duplicate detection' logic in the frontend (check if trade ID or date+symbol exists).
9. MATCHING LOGIC: Implement the 'Auto-match Buy/Sell' logic. Group trades by Symbol, then sort by Date. Match a Buy with the next Sell (FIFO or LIFO based on user pref, default to FIFO).
10. TESTING: Add `data-testid` to all inputs, buttons, and key metric displays.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts. Use the 'Control Room' grid.
Create depth through z-index and subtle borders, not heavy shadows.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable inside containers, but keep the grid gaps tight (gap-4).
NEVER use AI assistant Emoji characters.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui.
